definition[0]: a change made in something in order to make it right or better
example[0]: I just need to make a few corrections, and then we can send it to the printer.
definition[1]: used to say that what you have just said is wrong and you want to change it
example[1]: That will basically cover 50 ... correction 60 percent of all charges.
definition[2]: the act of changing something in order to make it right or better
example[2]: Please hand in your papers for correction.
definition[3]: punishment for people who have done something wrong or illegal
definition[4]: a change in the prices on a financial market, usually when they fall quickly because they have been too high and are no longer related to the real condition of companies and the economy
example[3]: Market watchers are expecting a stockmarket correction in February.
example[4]: The fall in equity prices in October 1987 may have been no more than a correction to the market.
